intro: Dionycha bojerii, commonly known as the Bojer's dionycha, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and white. Dionycha bojerii thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to drought conditions with its water-storing tissues. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
